This is the kind of film one watches in gape-jawed, horrified silence, and yet continues to watch, mesmerized, as if watching a horror flick. For four-plus hours it presents gruesome execution by the Koreans of countless captured Japanese soldiers; and one scene shows Koreans soldiers slowly disemboweling another Korean group suspected of spying on their comrades. One can imagine why director Shin Sang-ok elected to portray these barbarities as they reflect Japanese atrocities during World War II.

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, they do not realize that what was going on with them is solely related to an unseen creature from thousands and thousands of years ago. Unfortunately for them, this creature wants to eat.
I give The Bone Snatcher 2 out of 5 Knuckle Bones.<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>
